fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-17316].
  {panel}

Situation:
We write a SOAP client for JIRA in JAVA. The client creates issues in JIRA and keeps issue's key. 
If you login directly to JIRA and move the issue to another project in JIRA (issue's key changes), a call of 
com.atlassian.jira.JiraSoapService.getIssue(jiraSessionToken, issuekey)
using the original key fails. 

On the other hand: 
Searching for an issue in JIRA via 'QUICK SEARCH' (even searching for a moved issue using its 'old' issue key) works fine and shows the (moved) issue.

Whish:
A call of 
com.atlassian.jira.JiraSoapService.getIssue(jiraSessionToken, issuekey)
should find the issue even if the issue was moved i.e. 'issuekey' is an 'old' one.
fields.summary: Add a method to remote API (SOAP) that looks up an issue by its key even if the issue has been moved

fields.description:
When moving an issue with sub-tasks between projects, we need to move the sub-tasks. Sometimes the fields of the moving issues need to change to fit into the target project.  The "Move" operation presents a mapping GUI for the parent issue when this needs to occur. It does not have a GUI for sub-tasks remapping. To move the sub-tasks it simply fills in the default value for fields that must change. For example, when moving a sub-task between projects its components field will be cleared. This can leave the sub-tasks in invalid states. For example, a moved sub-task will be invalid in a target project with compulsory components. 

This is a problem for at least the Component and Due Date field.

The simplest solution would be to use the "Bulk Move" operation to perform a "Move". The bulk move has the step to configure the sub-task mappings that the regular move does not. All that would be required would be to hide the fact that we are doing a bulk move while performing a logical "Move".
fields.summary: The "Move" operation may produce subtasks with invalid empty values in target project

fields.description:
(Sub-tasks must be enabled in JIRA)

When creating a new filter from Simple mode, if you select the "Standard Issue Types" parent option for the issue type field in the filter form, then when you switch to Advanced mode, the generated clause will be {{type in standardIssueTypes()}}. You can then modify this query in Advanced mode (e.g. add {{AND status = Open}} or something that fits), then switch back to Simple mode, and the "Standard Issue Types" parent option will still be used.

If you create a new filter from Advanced mode however, and begin with the clause {{type in standardIssueTypes()}}, then when you switch to Simple mode, instead of the "Standard Issue Types" option being selected, it is actually the explicit list of all standard issue types multi selected. Thus, if you modify the filter, then go back to Advanced mode, you no longer have the original clause but something like {{type IN (1, 2, 3, 4)}} instead.
fields.summary: StandardIssueTypes() JQL function does not correctly switch into simple mode

fields.description:
h3. Summary

We have a custom field of type *URL Field* and some people have issues where that field is not filled in correctly. Every time (I am guessing its viewed), a huge stack trace is logged.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a URL Custom Field.
# Get an incorrect URL in there (either by updating the database or otherwise).
# View the issue.

h3. Expected Results

The logs advise which issue the problem relates to.

h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown:

{noformat}
2009-05-05 16:32:32,668 http-8282-Processor39 WARN [issue.customfields.impl.AbstractSingleFieldType] Value stored in database is invalid 
com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.FieldValidationException: Not a valid URL 
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.URLCFType.getSingularObjectFromString(URLCFType.java:25) 
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.StringCFType.getObjectFromDbValue(StringCFType.java:25)

        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.CustomFieldImpl.getValue(CustomFieldImpl.java:266) 
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.CustomFieldImpl.hasValue(CustomFieldImpl.java:969) 
        at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor1289.invoke(Unknown Source) 
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25) 
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597) 
{noformat}

h3. Notes

When testing in 7.2 I was not able to reproduce the above exception, as the below is output:

{code}
2016-09-23 12:41:40,390 http-nio-62189-exec-15 WARN admin 761x1093x1 1c3rfhr 172.22.48.96 /secure/AjaxIssueEditAction!default.jspa [c.a.j.i.customfields.impl.AbstractSingleFieldType] Issue WITI-75 has an invalid value '123.com' stored in the field 'URL Field'. Not a valid URL
{code}

fields.description:
When doing project import, jira will require in the destination instance all groups that have been used as 'Viewable By' in any comment for *all projects* in the original backup. 

Steps to reproduce:

# Have a Jira instance with two projects, A and B
# In the Admin > General Configuration, set "Groups & Project Roles" in the Comment visibility
# In project A, add a comment viewable by a specific group that does not exist in the destination instance.
# take a backup of the Jira instance
# In the destination instance, try to import project B

The project importer will require the existence of the group, even though the comment is in a different project. Jira should only require the groups that have been used in the viewable by in the comments for the project we are trying to import.
fields.summary: Project import tries to import groups for any project's comment visibility field

and

This field accepts html, be sure to close all tags"

and

And then add some precanned messages including ones with nice Confluence box macros as described at

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACOM/Announcement+Banner+templates?focusedCommentId=189431898&#comment-189431898

fields.description:
We use two kinds of features that require setting assignee that depends on a custom fields value, currently there is no way to add metadata to each value in a customfield and then use this metadata during workflow transitions.

Example of usage:

* Several projects have an issue type of "Documentation" which is assigned to the technical writers
* The "Documentation" issue type has a custom field named "Publications" which sets the destination document that needs editing.
* Different documents get edited by different technical writers

If in this situation we could create metadata per value of the "Publications" customfield with the value of the "assignee", we could then auto-assign these issues to the correct technical writer in the "create issue" workflow transition.
fields.summary: Using properties of customfield values during a workflow post-function

fields.description:
Custom field of type 'URL' doesn't accept following URLs, for example:

testdirector:host:port/qcbin,TRADING,Forklift,maxim;2:20

Error: 'Not a valid URL' upon form submission.

Albeit not commonly looking, the above URL should be considered valid according to RFC 1738 (Uniform Resource Locators (URL)).

"In general, URLs are written as follows:

       <scheme>:<scheme-specific-part>

   A URL contains the name of the scheme being used (<scheme>) followed
   by a colon and then a string (the <scheme-specific-part>) whose
   interpretation depends on the scheme."

http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc1738.txt

The above URLs are produced by HP QualityCenter software and we want to add link issues from Jira to it.
fields.summary: Validator for custom fields of type 'URL' is too restrictive
Why not use Status Id as Step id in OSWorkflow?

As a former FogBugz User, i really appreciated the feature that you can send an email from within FogBugz which automaticly creates an issue and where the customer can reply to which is also tracked with default bug tracking standards. This way you can send an email to the customer which says "You need to buy another server for Application A" and this issue can be tracked and also replied to by the customer. 

Something like all CRM Systems have. So that when you send an email from SalesForce to a customer, this email becomes part of the salesForce database as a contact item or something.
fields.summary: create issue by sending email to customer within JIRA

Steps:

2. On the home tab, create 2-3 dashboards and add gadgets to them.
3. On one of the dashboard, view one gadget in canvas mode.
4. Don't go to dashboard mode and click on some other dashboard. Now return to same dashboard.
5. The dashboard open with gadget in canvas mode.
6. Click the "Canvas" icon to return to dashboard mode.

Result:
1. In the dashboard mode all the other gadgets are in minimized state.
2. User can't expand the gadgets as in drop down menu also, minimize option is there.
3. Just clicking between the gadgets solve the problem.

Expected: 
1. Gadgets in dashboard should be in same state as they are before.

fields.description:
People leave.  They get fired.  They die.

But through all that they are still in Jira.  We change their password to a random one, and edit the email address. But this still clutters up our lists of assignable users, and occasionally results in a dearly departed getting assigned an issue.  Jira prevents us from deleting them:

{panel}
This user cannot be deleted at this time because there are issues assigned to them, they have reported issues, or they are currently the lead of a project.
Please note that any components with this user set as the lead will have the component lead set to empty when the user is deleted.
{panel}

I am aware that we can bulk assign the reporter to someone else... but then we loose valuable at a glance history.  What we'd like is to really disable the users, without deleting them.

There are many dupes of this report, most closed as "won't fix".
fields.summary: Alternate to "delete user" -- leave user in Jira but actually disable

fields.description:
1. Create a new issue
2. Spend tons of time typing and formatting the comment portion of your issue.
3. Now click (or accidentally click) Control-A
*POOF*
4. You are now starting at some Administrator screen.  You know: Ctrl-A for Administration..  an industry accepted hot key, right?  WRONG.

Ctrl-A in emacs means "start of line".  Any emacs user does it without thinking.
Ctrl-A on the Mac means "start of line" because Apple hired a lot of coders that used emacs.

Did we see a confirmation popup?  Something like this:
{noformat}
Warning, you are about to drop all your work on the floor and go to Administration.
Is this really what you want to do?  Are you nuts?
     [ Yes- throw my work on the floor  ]   |   [ No - I work for a living  ]
{noformat}

Now, oddly enough, *this* version of JIRA does not intercept and bastardize Ctrl-A.  It moves the cursor to the start of the line.

Why is *our* version of JIRA doing this?  We appear to be running:

{noformat}
Enterprise Edition, Version: 3.12.3-#302
{noformat}

Do we need to add a secret profile entry in one of the xml files?  Something like this:

{code}
  <property name="hijack-control-a-just-for-fun-and-make-it-do-something-really-evil">DISABLED</property>
{code}
fields.summary: The hotkey Control-A is bound to something horrible and does not prompt you to save your changes

2. Suppose we have sub task blocking condition activated for the project in the workflow.
3. Once all sub task are closed, user closes the parent issue.
4. Now User can't create new sub task for closed parent issue.
5. Try reopening the subtask without reopening the parent issue.

Result:
1. User can reopen the subtask for a closed parent issue.

Expected:
1. User should n't be allowed to reopen the issue till parent issue is not reopened/open.

No plugin factories found for plugin file Unit:

fields.summary: JIRA won't start if plugin with no or bad pluginsVersion defined

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-17178].
  {panel}

The RemoteWorklog bean is used both for getting worklogs from server and for creating/updating worklogs. When creating or updating worklogs, the server seems to get the value for the duration from timeSpent property (sic! there's no hint in documentation whether timeSpent or timeSpentInSeconds is used). 

The documentation for setTimeSpent() mentions the "short" format accepted by the server, e.g. "1d 2h".

However, when RemoteWorklog is retrieved from the server with "pretty time format" configured in Time Tracking administration section, this property will contain "pretty" values - "1 day, 2 hours". 

This makes it impossible to write a simple code that downloads a worklog, makes correction to a comment and uploads it back.
fields.summary: Inconsistent duration format in SOAP API worklog-related methods

fields.description:
SOAP API docs for addWorklogWithNewRemainingEstimate and other xxxWorklogWithNewRemainingEstimate methods say that newRemainingEstimate (which is of type String for some reason) should contain the new value for remaining estimate in seconds, while in fact JIRA processes the request as if this parameter was specified in minutes.

I hope the implementation is correct and you only need to update docs.
fields.summary: SOAP API docs for addWorklogWithNewRemainingEstimate say newRemainingEstimate parameter is in seconds

fields.summary: Planning board: Provide "Collapse All"

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Create an issue in Project A and add an image type attachment.
2. Move that issue to Project B using the option from issue itself, but wait before confirming the Bulk Move.
3. In a second browser, log in with the same user, Move the same issue to Project B, and confirm the operation. You can see that the issue is moved, it got assigned a new issue id in the new project, and the attachment is moved to the correct path.
4. Confirm the bulk move in the first browser. It will also work fine.
5. Now in the HDD where attachment is stored, just verify it

Result:
1. For image type attachment, its storing two copies in the new issue ID
2. Its working fine when I tried with attachment of type doc & PDF

Expected:
1. Only one copy of the attachment should be stored.
fields.summary: During the parallel move of issues, its creating duplicate copy for image type attachments
